metadata.title: CVE-2021-47334 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:misc/libmasm/module: Fix two use after free in ibmasm_init_one Inibmasm_init_one, it calls ibmasm_init_remote_input_dev(). Insideibmasm_init_remote_input_dev, mouse_dev and keybd_dev are allocated byinput_allocate_device(), and assigned to sp->remote.mouse_dev andsp->remote.keybd_dev respectively. In the err_free_devices error branch ofibmasm_init_one, mouse_dev and keybd_dev are freed by input_free_device(),and return error. Then the execution runs into error_send_message errorbranch of ibmasm_init_one, where ibmasm_free_remote_input_dev(sp) is calledto unregister the freed sp->remote.mouse_dev and sp->remote.keybd_dev. Mypatch add a "error_init_remote" label to handle the error ofibmasm_init_remote_input_dev(), to avoid the uaf bugs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47334` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2053-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2053.55
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2053-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2053.55
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2035-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2035.39
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2035-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2035.39
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2018-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2018.20
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2018-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2018.20
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1069.78').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2053.55').
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2035.39').
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2018.20').
